subject: Horse Racing
lead_paragraph: The Breeders’ Cup has reversed its decision to cut financial support for certain stakes races at about 40 North American tracks after getting a barrage of complaints from the industry. While the organization is making no long-term commitment to the stakes program, which currently affects 121 races, it announced that it would continue at least for one more year. William S. Farish Jr., the Breeders’ Cup chairman, said the organization would tap into its reserve funds to contribute the $4.5 million that it announced last week would be cut from the program because of budget concerns.
